means: [女子名] [苏格兰人姓氏] 普里姆罗斯住所名称，来源于威尔士的不列颠对应词，含义是“树+荒原”(tree+moor)，但后来民俗语源融合了“樱草花”(primrose)
[地名] [南非共和国] 普里姆罗斯

sentence.Network_en: Primrose, stupefied by tiredness, began to wail that she was hungry.
sentence.Network_cn: 普丽姆罗丝累得精神都有些恍惚了，开始哭着说她饿了。

sentence.Network_en: Primrose was given an apple, left over from our picnic lunch.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们中午野餐剩下的一个苹果给了普丽姆罗丝。

sentence.Network_en: She is in the primrose of her life.
sentence.Network_cn: 她正处在她一生的最盛期.

lj.lj_ly: blithely unaware of his doom, he continued down his primrose path.
lj.lj_ls: 他快乐得忘了命运劫数，继续走着通向黄泉的享乐之路。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: compare with Old French primerose and medieval Latin prima rosa, literally 'first rose'

entry.def: A primrose is a wild plant which has pale yellow flowers in the spring.

means.word_mean: 1. any of numerous short-stemmed plants of the genus Primula having tufted basal leaves and showy flowers clustered in umbels or heads

Wild flowers such as orchids and primroses are becoming rare.

sentences.en: If we followed your advice we’d all be walking down the primrose path to ruin.
